page.title: 05WHAPLODE DROVE-AGRICULTURE 1
page.content: This area is very flat land and is below sea level.It has very good drainage with lots of dykes.This area used to be marsh but now it is very rich land and expensive to buy (up to Â£3,500 an acre.It is reclaimed land and there is a lot of weedkiller,pest controller and fertilizer used in farming.In this area most of the crops are cereal crops closely followed by sugarbeet,potatoes bulbs and small amounts of brassica,onions, peas, tomatoes,strawberries and rape (which is made into oil).Some people keep a few chickens or goats as well as other animals.In this area there are 1 herd of cows,2 flocks of sheep,1 farm with pigs,1farm with geese and 1 farm with large chicken houses.Quite a lot of people have a few acres that they farm as well as their main job.
